description: A user who values bold, colorful, and artistic designs. They work in creative fields and love expressive, innovative web interfaces.
A user deeply concerned with accessibility—either due to personal needs or as an advocate. Prioritizes high contrast, readable fonts, keyboard navigation, and screen-reader compatibility.
A user who enjoys exploring new technology. Loves advanced features, cutting-edge design, and lots of customization options.
A light user who mostly browses for news, shopping, and emails. Prefers clean, simple, and easy-to-use websites.
Shops online frequently. Looks for fast checkouts, price comparisons, trust signals, reviews, and secure payment options.
An older adult who is less tech-savvy. Prefers large fonts, simple navigation, and clear instructions.
Browses almost exclusively on a smartphone. Values responsive design, fast loading, and thumb-friendly navigation.
Spends hours on gaming platforms and forums. Loves dark themes, high performance, and interactive elements.
Constantly reads news and articles. Wants clean typography, no clutter, and a focus on readability and up-to-date content.
Frequently publishes content. Prioritizes intuitive content management, distraction-free writing environments, and responsive design.
Browses academic resources and databases. Needs fast-loading, well-structured, citation-friendly pages with advanced search tools.
Spends hours on social media. Loves sleek, engaging designs and seamless notifications.
Cares deeply about privacy. Values clear data policies, minimal tracking, and customizable privacy settings.
Cares about sustainability. Prefers green-themed designs and seeks eco-friendly brands and transparency on environmental impact.
Uses wellness apps and health sites frequently. Wants calm, clean design and clear, trustworthy information.
Engages with tutorials and project sites. Prefers detailed guides, clear visuals, and easy-to-search resources.
Uses booking and travel sites often. Prioritizes fast-loading, reliable, and mobile-optimized sites with clear pricing.
Manages investments and banking online. Looks for high-security, clear data visualizations, and intuitive dashboards.
Streams movies, music, and TV. Wants immersive, fast-loading media platforms with simple navigation.
Uses language learning apps and websites. Values interactive elements, gamification, and intuitive design.
Seeks family-focused content. Wants safe, simple-to-navigate, and trustworthy sites for parenting tips and kids’ resources.
Uses productivity and collaboration tools daily. Wants responsive, clean UIs with strong focus on usability and performance.
A user who mistrusts any new interface, refuses to read instructions, and gets frustrated quickly when things aren't obvious.
Wants flashy animations and cutting-edge design but complains bitterly about slow loading times and battery usage.
Uses dozens of tabs and apps at once, often forgets where things are, and blames poor design for their confusion.
Notices and nitpicks every tiny flaw, from pixel misalignment to minor wording choices, and finds fault even in well-polished designs.
Only uses the site once and expects a seamless, intuitive experience without signing up or engaging with tutorials.
Skims pages quickly, often misses important information, and gets frustrated when things don't magically work without reading.
Wary of all new technologies, dislikes change, and longs for websites that look and behave like they did 10 years ago.
Hates any form of personalization, but also complains when the site doesn't 'understand' their needs.
Wants personalized recommendations and seamless logins but is extremely resistant to sharing any personal data.
Wants extremely fast responses but inputs incorrect or incomplete information, blaming the system when errors occur.
Spends hours tweaking settings but then forgets what they changed and expects defaults to work flawlessly.
Switches between multiple devices constantly and expects perfectly synced, identical experiences every time.
Uses outdated hardware and slow internet but expects lightning-fast performance and modern UI.
Adds and removes items from carts endlessly, reads countless reviews, and blames unclear design for their indecision.
Complains when a specialized site doesn’t work like a major platform (e.g., wants a government site to feel like Amazon).
